alert.note: Alert for Hartford (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 9:05PM EST until December 18 at 11:30PM EST by NWS Boston
info.description: ...Observed flooding changed to Minor severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Connecticut... Farmington River At Unionville affecting Hartford County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Farmington River at Unionville. * WHEN...Until late this evening. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Minor flooding of lowland areas along the river is expected, and may include lowest lying homes and businesses along Route 4. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 PM EST Monday the stage was 12.2 feet. - Bankfull stage is 12.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:30 PM EST Monday was 13.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall to 7.5 feet early Thursday afternoon. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 12.2 feet on 03/11/2011. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1130 PM EST.
